repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

comment_data.body: The behaviour of these changes slightly now - they're no longer dropped completely but just added to the class dictionary (where presumably they'll do nothing). This seems a fairly inconsequential change but it would be possible to revert it if needed. I've just dropped the tests because I don't think we really care what happens to them.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -8,32 +8,9 @@ __doc__ = u"""
     >>> vs0 = VerySpecial(0)
     VS __init__ 0
 
-    >>> # Python 3 does not use __cmp__, so any provided __cmp__ method is
-    >>> # discarded under Python 3.
-    >>> vs0_cmp = vs0.__cmp__  # doctest: +ELLIPSIS

comment_data.body: Now that we have a warning, why not warn about `__div__`, `__oct__` etc. as well? If users choose Cython 3.1, it's because they target Python versions where these are useless. A warning would point at legacy code that users can remove on their side.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -932,38 +914,28 @@ def __init__(self, old_binops):
             BinopSlot(bf, "nb_add", "__add__", method_name_to_slot),
             BinopSlot(bf, "nb_subtract", "__sub__", method_name_to_slot),
             BinopSlot(bf, "nb_multiply", "__mul__", method_name_to_slot),
-            BinopSlot(bf, "nb_divide", "__div__", method_name_to_slot,

comment_data.body: We can probably also get rid of this struct name alias now, in one of the next PRs.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1036,10 +999,8 @@ def __init__(self, old_binops):
             EmptySlot("tp_getattr"),
             EmptySlot("tp_setattr"),
 
-            # tp_compare (Py2) / tp_reserved (Py3<3.5) / tp_as_async (Py3.5+) is always used as tp_as_async in Py3
-            MethodSlot(cmpfunc, "tp_compare", "__cmp__", method_name_to_slot, ifdef="PY_MAJOR_VERSION < 3"),
             SuiteSlot(self. PyAsyncMethods, "__Pyx_PyAsyncMethodsStruct", "tp_as_async",

comment_data.body: If the proposed alternative is defined, we could adapt the warning message to "…; ignoring it and using … instead".
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -381,6 +381,9 @@ def slot_code(self, scope):
         for method_name in self.alternatives:
             entry = scope.lookup_here(method_name)
             if entry and entry.is_special and entry.func_cname:
+                warn_once(entry.pos,
+                          f"{method_name} was removed in Python 3; use {self.method_name} instead",
+                          2)

comment_data.body: It's a little harder because it's the alternative that generates the warning and these don't have alternatives. I decided it probably wasn't worth the effort for this.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -932,38 +914,28 @@ def __init__(self, old_binops):
             BinopSlot(bf, "nb_add", "__add__", method_name_to_slot),
             BinopSlot(bf, "nb_subtract", "__sub__", method_name_to_slot),
             BinopSlot(bf, "nb_multiply", "__mul__", method_name_to_slot),
-            BinopSlot(bf, "nb_divide", "__div__", method_name_to_slot,

comment_data.body: This would be fairly easy to do.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -381,6 +381,9 @@ def slot_code(self, scope):
         for method_name in self.alternatives:
             entry = scope.lookup_here(method_name)
             if entry and entry.is_special and entry.func_cname:
+                warn_once(entry.pos,
+                          f"{method_name} was removed in Python 3; use {self.method_name} instead",
+                          2)

@@ -244,7 +244,7 @@ def warn_once(position, message, level=0):
     echo_file = threadlocal.cython_errors_echo_file
     if echo_file:
         _write_file_encode(echo_file, line)
-    warn_once_seen[message] = True
+    warn_once_seen.add(message)

commit.message: Add warning for case where fallback is found

milestone.description: Remove support for Python 2 and Python < 3.8.
